H0.text: The chemical element antimony is found in nature mainly as which sulphite mineral. SbSO3

H1.text: The chemical element antimony is found in nature mainly as which sulphite mineral. Sb2(SO3)3

H2.text: The chemical element antimony is found in nature mainly as which sulphite mineral. SbS2

H3.text: The chemical element antimony is found in nature mainly as which sulphite mineral. Sb2S3

A4.text: Stibnite is a sulfide mineral, a mineral form of antimony trisulfide (Sb2S3).

A6.text: Antimony trisulfide (Sb2S3) is found in nature as the crystalline mineral stibnite and the amorphous red mineral metastibnite.

A7.text: The structure of the black needle-like form of Sb2S3, stibnite, consists of linked ribbons in which antimony atoms are in two different coordination environments, trigonal pyramidal and square pyramidal.

A8.text: Recent work suggests that there are a number of closely related temperature dependent structures of stibnite which have been termed stibnite (I) the high temperature form, identified previously, stibnite (II) and stibnite (III).
